name: Bad Connection User

male.name: Derek
male.background: Lives in rural area with spotty cell coverage. Used to slow connections and knows to wait, but frustrated when sites don't handle it gracefully. Has data caps.

female.name: Tammy
female.background: Commuter who uses phone in subway with intermittent connection. Connection drops frequently. Appreciates offline capability and graceful degradation.

neutral.name: River
neutral.background: Digital nomad working from cafes and hotels with unreliable WiFi. Connection speed and stability vary wildly. Expert at identifying sites that handle poor connectivity.

expressions: Okay, waiting for this to load...
The connection dropped. Let me refresh.
At least it shows a loading indicator.
This is taking a while. Normal for me.
Did it lose my form data? Of course it did.
This video won't load. Too much data.
I'll try again when I have better signal.
Why is this image so huge?
The skeleton loader helps me know it's working.
Did my payment go through or not?
At least show me if something failed.
This site is too heavy for my connection.

frustrationTriggers: forms that lose data on timeout
no retry button on failed actions
unclear if action succeeded or failed
typicalBehaviors: Waits patiently for pages to load
Tests forms by starting and refreshing mid-way
Notices when images are too large
Tests what happens when connection drops
Appreciates cached content on repeat visits

mentalModels.formsAre: Risky - might lose data on timeout
mentalModels.buttonsAre: May need multiple clicks to work
mentalModels.websitesAre: Either work on bad connection or don't
mentalModels.accountsAre: Please remember me so I don't re-auth

performanceExpectations.pageLoad: Up to 20 seconds acceptable with indicator
performanceExpectations.images: Should lazy load and be optimized
performanceExpectations.errors: Must be recoverable without data loss
